characters: THE SQUAD STAGGERING OUT OF THE BAYOU
WALKING DOWN A SMALL BAYOU LATE
AT A FORK IN THE BAYOU MORNING
THE OTHER SIDE OF THE TRACK
EXT, CLEARING NEXT TO A HUGE BAYOU
DENSE UNDERBRUSH AWAY FROM THE WATER
THE SQUAD AT THE WATER BARREL
A THOUSAND YEAR OLD DEAD CYPRESS
MASTERSON CRAWLING UP BEHIND THE SHACK

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ARMORY NIGHT
dialogues.text: Warehouse district, near the river... A statue of a Confederate soldier stands in the shadows, his rifle held high and proud. Beyond, a Civil War cannon points out from the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: bright and blinding from down the street, they pass over statue and find a sign: "Louisiana National Guard"...The ear slowly glides into the Armory parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SEI OF HEADLIGHTS
dialogues.text: as a pick-up truck down-shifts. From the opposite end of the street another vehicle approaches, followed by more headlights...and more headlights...and more again. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT. ARMORY NIGHT
dialogues.text: Two basketball hoops. Framed photos of Generals and milit leaders. An American flag.crossed with the state banner o Louisiana...Spelled out in bold letters across the far wa "This is the Home of the. Best Infantry Company in the Wo

dialogues.speaker: ONE HUNDRED NATIONAL GUARDSMEN
dialogues.text: Some sit or lie on the cement, others lean: against the b wall, still others fueling up on coffee and donuts. U.S, Army fatigues everywhere; boots, bayonets, buttpacks, amm pouches, canteens hanging from pistol belts, steel pot he with camouflage nets... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A whistle blows.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Fall int Grudgingly, the men start to assemble, picking up their duffle bags and forming lines. Again the whistle blows.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Come on, fall in!

dialogues.speaker: ROLL CALL FORMATION
dialogues.text: Four platoons, 110 men standing alongside their duffles. The First Sergeant moves before them and begins shouting names from a clipboard. Each man answers with a half- hearted "yeah" or "yo".

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Marian...Masterson\..Mayhew... Maxvill...Meadows...Merritt... Middlebrook... These are the weekend warriors. Some having signed on years ago to duck the draft, some of them just like being in the club, the others. in for the money each month and the prospect of a pension. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPANY
dialogues.text: Now at parade rest. A man appears at the far doorway.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Company!

dialogues.speaker: PLATOON LEADERS
dialogues.text: Platoon!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Aten-Hut! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: C& The Guardsmen come to attention as Captain Underwood e and exchanges a snappy salute with the First Sergeant. .

dialogues.speaker: FIRST SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Company all present or accounted for, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Take your post, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN UNDERWOOD
dialogues.text: Late forties. Lean and mean. Hair cut yesterday. Boots glistening, fatigues starched. His voice crisp, sharp. Complete command.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: At ease. The Company relaxes. Men shift weight, scratch.

dialogues.speaker: , CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Platoon sergeants. After your men draw their weapons you'll be in the trucks ready to move out at 0500. There is the possibility some battalion brass will be coming down to observe you people...Please for once in your life could you try to look like soldiers...

dialogues.speaker: PLATOON LEADERS
dialogues.text: Platoon!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Aten-Hut! The Company snaps to attention.

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN CLEOIIS WILSON
dialogues.text: Black; 25 years old, a lineman for Louisiana Bell Telepho His mental agility belies his 11th grade education. Marri Sa (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: two children, a third on the way. As he stands at attenti he notices a lone figure slowly making his way across the Armory.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Here he is, pride of the regiment. All eyes target on:

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN TERRANCE LEE ATWATER
dialogues.text: handsome, with the look of youth that comes from living the soft life. His hair flops over his forehead,. coverin a portion of his glasses. His boots need a shine, his uniform a pressing. Not a sad sack, but he is spoiled Southern. His steel helmet is tied to the duffle bag and clangs out as he drags it across the cement floor. As he passes the Captain, Atwater casually flicks a salute in the officer's general direction.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: You're late, soldier. To the snickering of the men and the stare of the Captain Atwater joins Ist ‘Squad, 2nd Platoon. Stands in line nex to Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Did I miss sick call?

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN VICTOR CALVELLI
dialogues.text: standing next to Wilson on the other side. -Wears a weddi ring. Thirty years old. A Chemical Engineer transferred down from New Jersey two months ago by Texaco. Not too thrilled about being here.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Platoon leaders, move ‘em out.

dialogues.speaker: Q THE GUARDSMEN
dialogues.text: being issued their rifles, checking their equipment, helping each other with their packs, loading gear into the trucks...the vehicles engines kick over, headlights . go on. ;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fortunate few sit on the folding benches along the side the others lying on the floor among their duffle bags and rifles...outside a young Lieutenant passes by, decides to look in for a regulation growl.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: You men comfortable?

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: Yes sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hear you! They roar back.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Good. The Lieutenant moves briskly on.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Why is everybody always yelling around here? He speaks with the voice of a man with a terrific hangove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roaring line of Jeeps and trucks snorting black exhaust headlights sweeping past the Armory.

dialogues.speaker: INIT. REAR OF TRUCK
dialogues.text: The last vehicle of the ten truck convoy shelters the men of the 2nd platoon; 40 of them taking the bumps, settling down, trying either to get comfortable or, even a better idea, to get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN EARL LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Big and solid. Red of neck. Likes a good time. Nineteen years old. He pulls a six pack of Dixie beer out of his duffle bag and offers it around after popping one open for himself.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Anybody for a brew? His pal Masterson makes the automatic reach. As does Atwater.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Hair of the dog.

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN LONNIE MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Late 20's. Works in the oil fields. Completed his three years regular Army and is in the Guard because he likes it. Drives a pick-up, wears a drooping moustache and sideburns...A life model for Longbrake.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Christ. Even the cows ain't up.

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN TYRONE SMITH
dialogues.text: Early 20's. Black, Street smart. Happy, as long as he's high, which is almost always. Longbrake Masterson

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: We there yet?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Hey, Tyrone. You ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Shit, I been getting ready all week on reds and whites...blues even. tosses out a few more beers. ATWATER . Where we spending the weekend?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Atchaflaya basin. Don't you ever listen up Atwater?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Why in Christ they taking us to the bonnies for?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Don't ask me. Hey Masterson, why in Christ are they taking us to the boonies for? looks back at Wilson with mild irritation.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Cause.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Oh I see. 'Long as you put it that way. Atwater takes a long drink of beer.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, ROADSIDE DAWN
dialogues.text: The convoy rolls through the suburbs of Baton Rouge; all quiet among the rows of houses beyond the rumbling column khaki colored vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: INT. REAR OF TRUCK DAWN
dialogues.text: Most of the 2nd Platoon now sound asleep, oblivious to th first rays of sunlight. A slow stretching move by one of the uniformed men...

dialogues.speaker: RIFLEMAN NOLAN YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Biggest of them all. And all of it's muscle. Teaches nint grade history and is also the varsity line coach at Lafay Union High School. He's not one to be taken lightly... Unfortunately he doesn't take himself lightly either, see cl himself as a scholar-athlete and is clearly a man who the sound of his own voice.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Trust you brought your portable air conditioner, Atwater.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: And refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Atwater's the only man in the history of the Guard that brings satin sheets to summer camp.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: What you all doin' in the truck with us anyway, Atwater? Why ain't you ridin' down on a polo pony?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Listen, my polo pony wouldn't associate with you guys.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: lights a cigarette and closes his eyes, trying to block o the bullshit. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE CONVOY
dialogues.text: Now moving along the Interstate highway. Morning breaking on a sharp, clear day...it's going to be a hot one...A little girl at a Gas Station waves as the trucks pass. Th Guardsmen give her the finger.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRUCK CAB DAWN
dialogues.text: Three men, Squad Leader Taylor, next to him a Sergeant fr the 2nd Squad and...

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD LEADER CLAUDE NORMAN
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel. His sleeves are pushed up and his right forearm has a tatoo of a pirate skull. He dropped out of high school to join the Army and fight in Nam, but they stopped the war. Pissed him off. Still has ideas though. ' Lives alone, keeps two cats. Subscribes to "Soldier of Fortune",

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Know what I hear? That they're looking for professionals in Africa.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Whores?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Mercenaries. In Mexico and Latin America too.. Pays $1300 a month plus transportation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Man could retire.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I read about it. They're lookin' all the time. :

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD LEADER CRAWFORD TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Two tours in Viet Nam. Decorated. Knows how to play the game. Going for his twenty year pension, already has nine in...The men of the 2nd Platoon all respect him; a good m to have on your side.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: They want combat soldiers, Norman. Not typists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks are moving laboriously down a four lane highwa In the distance an isolated shopping center site stands h constructed.

dialogues.speaker: INT. REAR OF TRUCK MORNING
dialogues.text: Longbrake looks across at the half-asleep Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Clitoris. Wilson cuts him off cold.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Cleotis.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. When we get down in them swamps, be sure you watch out for those snakes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I'll watch for them. I just don't want them watchin' for me.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Someone has finally said something that interests him...o at least something that he thinks he ought to know about.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What kind of snakes?

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Moccasins. Copperheads.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: One a them bites you, you bend over, stick your head between your knees and kiss your ass goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: quietly reaches into his pocket and pulls out a box of 5- ammunition. Without drawing attention from the others, snaps a shell into the chamber of his M-16.

dialogues.speaker: . GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: When I was training in Fort Benning, our instructor got bit right here by a coral snake. He extends his right arm.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: He put his hand on a log, took his machette, and cut his hand right off, I swear to God. Groans and smiles; nobody believes him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONT INUED.
dialogues.text: Masterson leans out over the tailgate of the truck, level his M-16 at the approaching supermarket construction site and sends a bullet into a huge plate glass window, a quar of a mile beyond.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMARKET
dialogues.text: The window shatters and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A proud smile shines out from under Masterson's moustache some of the boys think this is the funniest thing they've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: I ain't worried about snakes. He reaches into his shirt and displays the box of live ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Shit, you sonofabitch. Why didn't you tell me you brought real ammo? A violent sway from the lurching vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck pulling over hard to the right, onto the should of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Braking sounds from the heavy vehicle...The small window separating the truck bed from the cab is snapped open.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Allright, what the fuck was that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Backfire.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Norman? |

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah? '

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you. |

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Why don't you get these sons of bitches tuned up, Norman. | Taylor's head appears at the window.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Whatever the hell's going on back there, knock it off... The Guardsmen go quiet. A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR '
dialogues.text: Okay, Norman let's go. The window again snaps up...a moment later the truck lurc into gear.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Wide smile. He got away with it.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: His stoical expression doesn't quite mask his contempt. Atwater is the only one quick enough to notice. He grins across to Calvelli.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah, we ain't smart, but we sure have fun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, SMALL TOWN EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: The Convoy leisurely moving down the business section; a shopkeeper is opening his General Store as the trucks rol past...the Old Man gets pelted with empty beer cans. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knocked out, sweaty, quiet as they bounce along. Then, finally, the truck grinds to a slow halt.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: We stopped.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: You're right up there with the latest news, aren't ya. Outside the truck a raspy male voice penetrates the morni air.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Alright! Let's go in there! Outta the truck! Slowly the men start dropping out over the tailgate. They fall and trip, getting hit with helmets, rifles, duffle b

dialogues.speaker: THE 1ST SQUAD, SECOND PLATOON
dialogues.text: Atwater, Calvelli, Youngblood, Smith, Longbrake, Masterso Wilson forming a loose rank and making an unhurried attem to get organized...They look across at the unfamiliar ter ‘THEIR POV: THE BAYOU Across a high levee...Marshes stretch to the horizon line Thin pines rise out of the misty swamps; the trees are bearded with moss but their branches are dead and bare.

dialogues.speaker: THE 1ST SQUAD
dialogues.text: Still near their truck; around them the bivouac area is jumping with activity as Guardsmen start digging trenches for latrines, laying wire, pitching tents. A Lieutenant i barking orders from the perimeter of the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Sergeant! Get your men digging in...I don't want to see you. I£ I can see you, the enemy can see you...Set up your security. He notices the men of the Ist Squad.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Hey you meatballs! What the hell do you think you're doing there... Why aren't you with your platoon?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Special detail, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: What kind of detail?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: With the truck. Make sure it's not captured, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Get over with your unit. Now! Load and lock down. They slowly move off. The Lieutenant turns his back; Wils uses this opportunity to give him a quick finger.

dialogues.speaker: THE 1ST SQUAD
dialogues.text: Sitting in the shade, slowly feeding blanks into the maga clips. Longbrake is loading the big M-60 Machine Gun, amm belts draped around his neck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Lord, this sun can broil a man alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Calvelli, bet you thought all the Louisiana Guard did was beat up on college kids and tear | gas niggers. The kind of comment that gives Wilson an opening.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Please mistah guardsman, no moah canisters. Don't let that shepherd , | dog loose on me. Longbrake wants to have some fun at the new man's expense as well; with studied casualness he points the big M-60 a Calvelli.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: ji Yeah, I remember seeing you guys on television, and say, pal... (pushes machine gun barrel away) don't be pointing that thing at me.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Only blanks.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I don't care if it's hundred dollar bills, don't point it at me. Edgy silence, long looks between the two men. Atwater dec to break the tension, only right since he was the one tha first got the ball rolling.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Longbrake, don't you be picking on our new man. Got to be polite to them foreign boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Q LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: You from New York?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: New Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Same difference.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. Norman runs up from across the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Alright, let's hurry it up. Don't just sit there. Soon as you're finished, go over with the rest of the platoon and get squared away.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yes, Norman. — LONGBRAKE Fuck you, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Too hot to be hurryin'. Norman waits impatiently while the Squad slowly pick them selves up.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Suppose. you're used to a little more serious soldiering back in | New Jersey.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Yeah, we had things organized. The only thing we did was watch the ball games on tee vee, shoot dice, and sleep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They get up and start moving, again looking off at the ba and the swamps beyond. Youngblood feels that the sight ca for his personal comment.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: The primordial swamp. That's where it all started, gentlemen. Right in there.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: That's real interesting, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: I know that you have trouble dealing with an abstract idea, Atwater. Atwater walks over near Calvelli, away from the main grou

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Gonna be a long fucking weekend if I have to listen to this shit.

dialogues.speaker: THE 1ST SQUAD
dialogues.text: moving slowly across the clearing; Taylor joins them, dra them into a circle. They light cigarettes, sit on their hélmets.

dialogues.speaker: . TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I got good news and bad news. Bad news is there is no good news. We're going on an over- night recon patrol. Massive groans.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, quit your bitching and listen up to Sgt. Taylor. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: That's enough of that...Alpha team will be recon. Bravo team security...Calvelli you're with Bravo. Looks over his men.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Levee up this way is our objective, rendezvous point is outside New Iberia. We're going to travel in overwatch and movement in file formation with maximum use of concealment...Smith, you with us? Smith obviously isn't.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Sure am Sergeant. I'm really up for this one.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Good, cause you're going to be my pace man. Big laugh from the boys. They know a good joke when they hear one.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Masterson'1l be: point...We're talking about 38 kilometers so make sure you fill your canteens at the water buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Any liquor stores open? Taylor ignores Atwater. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Every member pitches in and pulls their weight. I don't want any- body dogging it out there. You're all buddies, counting and depending on each other. Everybody does their job. Turns away.

dialogues.speaker: THE 1ST SQUAD
dialogues.text: filling their canteens from the spigots on the tanker tru fixing their butt packs, adjusting straps, ponchos...Wils is pulling the big P.R.C. two-way communicator into place on his back, then positions the pads to keep it from cutt into his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: We sure get all the good details.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: This will be good exercise for you. Put a little muscle in your pants. Youngblood enjoys his own feeble joke.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: That's the last thing I need, Coach. Unless you want to take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Anything you like, Longbrake. Speaking for myself I prefer women.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Big chance we got of that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ® ATWATER Life's full of surprises, son.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Atwater's got their full attention. He plays the moment, pausing, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I have arranged for a little treat for the weekend, boys. Six whores de combat presently awaiting our assault...I'm sure they'll fuck us in a more inter- esting way than the National Guard of the state of Louisiana has.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: You're not kidding, are you?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: a I never joke about women.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: I haven't been laid in six hours. I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: . MASTERSON
dialogues.text: How they gonna meet us?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, where are they?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Holed up, waiting my call. (he moves around to Wilson, puts his arm around the big P.R.C. radio) That responsibility for contact rests on my old buddy Wilson, and his trusty walkie talkie. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: You got one for me?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Me? You mean us, don't you brother? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Now boys remember, the purpose of the National Guard is to keep you darker brothers away from decent Southern women... But in the spirit of the New South I have made full arrange- ments. Smiles all around. And a few cheers.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Atwater, you ain't all bad. They begin moving away from the water buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: THE 1ST SQUAD
dialogues.text: They are now nine combat ready men, walking in file. Swea begins to seep through their fatigues. Twigs and pieces o bush now grow from their steel helmets. Sgt. Taylor has field glasses, amp, flashlight and compass. Wilson is alo side...Longbrake packs the big M-60 machine gun, ammo bel draped around his neck. All the rest have M-16 rifles... The Squad moves forward, walking up and over the levee to the bayou.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, people used to live all up and down these bayous. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Government cleared them out.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Must of been tough leaving a real paradise like this. The Squad clears the crest of the levee. At the fringe of the bayou they slowly pull up, look off at the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Norman, shape them up and test fire. This is as good a place as any. Norman whirls and begins shouting; this is the kind of assignment he takes very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Squad. Forma line. Every rifleman 20 feet apart! .

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, what is it Longbrake?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you. The men spread out, open their ammo pouches, slap the mag zines into the breeches of their M-16's, slide the bolts and commence firing. Atwater takes advantage of this mome to aim and fire at Wilson...

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Don't do that, mother fucker. Longbrake's M-60 machine gun spits out a few blank shells Then all goes quiet once more.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Masterson, we want to move out on a heading of zero six five. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Yo. He moves off a confident experienced soldier, qualities h shares only with Taylor among the other members of the Br team.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: moving off into the swamp following thirty yards behind Masterson's point. The quality of the moment so excites Atwater that he brea into song:

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Over hill, Over dale, As we hit the dusty trail... The spirit is infectious; the entire Squad save Taylor, Norman and Calvelli join in.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD
dialogues.text: And those caissons keep rolling along. It's hi hi hee In the field artillery And those caissons go rolling... Some members of the Bravo Team substitute the words "fuck for caissons. cut To:

dialogues.speaker: INT. SWAMP DAY
dialogues.text: Hot, humid, dense foliage climbing alongside a small bayo twenty yards wide. The muddy water is still and tepid, punctuated only by floating water vegetation. Birds call, the buzz of insects, a bull frog belches.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE BAYOU
dialogues.text: His camouflage blends him into the foliage. He looks righ then left, up the bayou, swings his rifle onto his should and takes a reading.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMPASS
dialogues.text: in palm of right hand. His left hand shields the dial fro the blazing sun.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: snaps the compass closed, tucks it away, wipes the sweat his face and takes a long swig from his canteen. He gives arm and hand signal to those behind, holds his rifle read and wades across the bayou.

dialogues.speaker: THE REST OF THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: They come out of the growth, in file, as Taylor waits for them. Masterson visible across the shallow body of water beyond.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you guys taking us?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: is almost at the opposite bank when he stumbles...stops, throws his rifle sling over his shoulder freeing his hand Masterson begins grappling with some fish netting that encases his feet.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: can see Masterson's difficulty from thirty yards back. Ge (CONTINUED)
What the hell is it? .

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: now cutting the net with his bayonet, tearing it loose fr the stream bed...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just some God damn drag line net. Frees himself and moves on.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: approaches the water's edge, not happy with his immediate prospects. ar] Christ.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Go ahead and cross the God damn thing, don't just stand there looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I can't go in there, I've got a terminal hangover.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Water will take care of it real nice.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I think I should go back. No kidding. I'm serious. Wilson pretends to send a radio message on his P.R.C. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Echo 7-1, request helicopter med-evac, top priority terminal hangover. Read me, roger and over.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Take up your position Atwater. Atwater crosses, sloshing through the calf-deep bayou, adjusting his backpack as he goes. Smith next approaches the water's edge...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Smith, how you doin' with the pace?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Great. 461 meters...more or less. Very large smile from Taylor; he's not depending on anyon else for direction or distance.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Right...Couldn't make it without you, Tyrone. Both men cross with Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CLEARING DAY
dialogues.text: The ist Squad eating C rations; they sit a few feet apart in the mossy shade of a cypress tree. Smith lifts one of the metal containers and for inexplicable reasons becomes engrossed reading the catalog of contents.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Meal. Combat individual. Pork, sliced and cooked...crackers, peanut butter, dried prunes...

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE WAY
dialogues.text: Wilson and Atwater huddled over the P.R.C.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: (presses the recharge button) * 7-1, 7-1, this is 7-8, over.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKING VOICE
dialogues.text: 7-8, this is 7-1.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Change in orders necessitates you make contact with advance party. Urgent. Move Operation Southern Belle to coordinates 07-035.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKING VOICE
dialogues.text: We copy. 07-035.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Battle position installations set for 2200 hours.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKING VOICE
dialogues.text: 2200 hours. Support troops standing by. Over. He puts the phone back and smiles at Atwater; Smith has heard the transmission.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: (big smile) Atwater, shittt...get them women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the pace, Tyrone?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: 380, 455, 770. Whatever one gets us to those ladies the fastest. Norman comes back across the clearing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, off and on. Break time's over. Let's go, move it. Longbrake can't afford to miss his cue.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Norman. Atwater slowly rises.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Civilian in peace, soldier in war, I am the Guard.

dialogues.speaker: THE LST SQUAD
dialogues.text: Again on the move in close file; the still water churns a the weeds break as the Guardsmen go wading through. Thoug it is mid-day and the sun is blazing, there is an eerie darkness to all. ,

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE SWAMP
dialogues.text: As the Squad comes moving through. Atwater and Wilson dod among the branches and undergrowth, trailed by Longbrake.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: The whole package will cost you sixty one dollars a month, covers everything, house, life, wife and kids.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Man, I told you before I can't afford that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everybody right. 30.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: A man in your line of work, climbing telephone poles all day, two kids, another in the oven, you can't afford hot to have full coverage.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Knock it off back there!

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Ah, fuck you up there.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: And keep those God damn helmets on!

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: D. Company. The dirty thirty.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: D for douche bag.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Dork company.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Doonesbury. looks at Youngblood, he can never get anything

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Doonesbury?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: (counting his pace) 478, 479...Dickheads! 382, 383, 384...

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay, knock it off. They walk a few yards in silence, then: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ©) CALVELLI Jesus! Jesus Christ! He drops to the ground, slapping and pulling at his pants

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: It's on me. Shit! Something's on me! Sgt. Taylor is the first one to him. The others gather ro

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Got a black widow on ya? Tarantula maybe? Longbrake just thinks it's funny as hell.

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE WOOD TICK
dialogues.text: a an inch across and unfortunately deeply imbedded in Cal N calf.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Okay take it easy now. Hold still. Taylor has his zippo out and puts the flame to the tick's backside...after the insect has pulled back he scrapes it off Calvelli's leg with his pocket knife.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: There. It's off.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: It's still bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You want it to. The rest of the men begin itching and scratching. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: You see that sucker?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: If you pull it off, the head stays in and you die.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: You don't die, Cretin. Your leg just gets infected.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Yeah. And rots off.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Who you calling a Cretin?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: You. Youngblood's much too big to argue with; the men of Bravo Team, dork company begin to shoulder their packs and move out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: moving through swamp a few paces ahead of the rest of the Squad save Masterson's point. He studies the map a bit, t returns it to his breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Smith, send up the pace.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: (from behind) Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Hey Lightning, Taylor wants the pace. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Pace? What pace you talkin bout? Oh, the pace. 635?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Tell him it's 635!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Wilson, inform Company we're crossing phase line Bob.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: (into phone) Echo 7-1, this is Echo 7-8, do you copy?

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKING VOICE
dialogues.text: Roger 7-8, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Have crossed phase line Bob, over.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKING VOICE
dialogues.text: That's a roger 7-8, you have crossed phase line Bob.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Okey dokey smokey.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAWKING VOICE
dialogues.text: 7-1, have received confirmation on Southern Belle. Advance party on manuevers anticipating small unit military penetration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilson breaks into a big, big smile.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: That is a roger. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What was all that about?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Damned if I know, I never can understand that man. He swats at a bug.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Damn mosquitos. Wilson turns, catches Atwater's eye and gives him a big s and the high sign. Atwater smiles, turns to Longbrake and nods. The word spreads, Operation Southern Belle is a go.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: He makes his way and stops at the edge of a large bayou, the biggest yet seen, some sixty yards wide. The rest of the Squad trails behind...

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: as he catches sight of the large body of water.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Looks like they built a new ocean here.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: I can't figure out where the hell we are. We should be right in here. (looks at his map) Now either this damn map is wrong or I can't find my way around the block. :

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: I kept right like you told me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know...bayou's must of shifted.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Want me to raise Company?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No need for that. Long as we keep going North we'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: moving along the bank of the bayou.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Get those weapons off your shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you Norman. You carry this elephant gun! Gestures to his big M-60...it does in fact weight forty-f pounds.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Not so close together. Watch your positions.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON ON POINT
dialogues.text: He stops, looks ahead, further along the edge of the bayo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-made dugouts, like big canoes, pulled up on high gro

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON MOVES DOWN TO THEM
dialogues.text: Both have long poles used for pushing forward. In the she (CONT INUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: of one of Masterson

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Masterson 36.

dialogues.speaker: SATURDAY AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: the craft are four dead neutria (giant furry rats). whistles to the others.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you. think they belong to?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Us.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: No they don't. They belong to the indiginous personnel. Don't fuck around with them.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Think they float?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Hell, yes. They're pirogues. Cajuns back here use ‘em all the time.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: They ain't using them now. turns to Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: What say we take them down the bayou?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Yeah. I can deal with that. Way my back feels.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Don't forget. I have a very impor- tant hangover. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Hell, we might make New Iberia tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Put them women under martial law.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What women you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Atwater's running ladies. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: He's got some ladies meeting us.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Atwater?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: It's all set...Noleen The Bayou Queen. And her court...Just a little something for morale.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Really? Doesn't seem to be happy with this news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Youngblood comes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++I don't think we should take the canoes. They're not ours.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: That's right they're not ours... Now let's get in them. They move for the pirogues. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Hold on, fungo. Nobody gave you an order. They stop and look at Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: A little R & R never hurts.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Part of being a soldier is learning to live off the land.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: How bout it, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Well now boys, I just don't know. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: What kind of foot soldier would take some beat up old boat? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: We would.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: You're right. Cheers. Whistles. They break for the pirogues.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Commandeer the swamp craft of indigenous personnel!

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: as they divide up, according to Taylor's orders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Wilson, Masterson, Youngblood, Atwater with me. Rest of you with Norman...Just watch out you don't tip the damn things over, Norman, Calvelli, Smith and Longbrake get in the pirogue. Longbrake holding the M-60 in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR'S PIROGUE
dialogues.text: The men squat down, Taylor has his map out.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Atwater, you take the pole.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Not me, Sarge. Let Youngblood do it. He's good at that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIROGUES GETTING UNDER WAY
dialogues.text: They are tricky and rock easily and almost tip, but the m keep their balance and both pirogues glide along, side by side, racing. The men are laughing and hollering.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON SEES SOMETHING
dialogues.text: He points back to the shore, laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this distance their features are unrecognizable, but t are big, dark and frightening men, in rubber hip boots.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Where'd they come from? Smith waves at them, uses a falsetto voice. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Hi, boys. Thanks for the boats.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: (fruity) I think they want their boats back. Masterson gives them the finger.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Fuck em!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR'S PIROGUE
dialogues.text: Taylor is yelling through cupped hands at the Cajuns.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We'll bring em back.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: They only speak French.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAJUNS
dialogues.text: staring...silent...ominous even at forty yards.

dialogues.speaker: BOTH PIROGUES
dialogues.text: twenty yards from opposite bank.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Can anybody speak French?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Sure. (he yells) Voulez-vous fuck me!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Knock that shit off! Taylor yells and points to the shore.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: We're bringing them back! The Cajuns watch them head farther across.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: (to Cajuns) Just dropping them off.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: They don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Dumb coonass bastards. From no place, Longbrake levels his machine gun at the Ca and opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Let em have it men! Take no prisoners!

dialogues.speaker: THE CAJUNS
dialogues.text: dive for cover as the machine gun bursts out.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Longbrake! YOU ASSHOLE! Some members of the Squad think this is even funnier than when Masterson took a shot at the supermarket. Masterson snaps off a shot, as does Wilson, Smith and Atwater. Big laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Knock that shit off! The Cajuns are no longer visible. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: Norman! Get your men off and get that damn boat back! Now!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Right. Push for that shoreline, Smith. The sound of a single rifle shot.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: God they shot him dead!

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: shot straight through the head -- killed instantly.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: drops his pole leaps back for Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: No! The pirogue tips over from the shifting weight and Youngb lunging motion. ¢

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN IN THE WATER
dialogues.text: They try to swim toward the near shore.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: The radio and rifle on his back keep pulling him down. He bobs, slapping at the water, then goes under. He's fighti to get free of the radio straps, and not winning.
SATURDAY AFTERNOON °

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER IN WATER
dialogues.text: Sees Wilson go under and tries to save him. Wilson is panicking, takes Atwater down with him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD DOG PADDLING
dialogues.text: Reaches Norman's pirogue and tries to climb on, tipping t pirogue over.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI SURFACING
dialogues.text: Sees Atwater and Wilson, and swims to help.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER, WILSON, CALVELLI
dialogues.text: One of the radio straps are free. Wilson is still fightin

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Leave him alone. I got him. Calvelli grabs Wilson from behind the neck. He slides the other strap off Wilson's shoulder and the radio sinks.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD STAGGERING OUT OF THE BAYOU
dialogues.text: Wet, scared, confused, they stumble, ducking behind trees

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Hit it! Get down.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Take cover!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: They shot him. They shot him!

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Lonnie! Over here. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Do you see them? Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: The dirty sons of bitches.

dialogues.speaker: THE OPPOSITE SHORE
dialogues.text: All is still. No Cajuns in sight.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Are they still shooting? Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Can't see them.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep down!

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: There's Atwater and them.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Taylor. We have to get Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Come on. Keeping low, they dart along, wade into the bayou and fis Taylor out.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER, WILSON, CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Coughing up water, they collapse in the mud bank. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Atwater. Over here. Atwater, Wilson and Calvelli run toward the rest of the S and protective cover.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: M-16 held ready, darting through the underbrush along the bayou shore. He peers across the water toward the far ban

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No movement, no-one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: hesitates for a moment, then turns back toward the interi

dialogues.speaker: DENSE UNDERBRUSH AWAY FROM THE WATER
dialogues.text: Taylor's corpse has been laid out...The men kneel, gaping their dead squad leader. Masterson trots up.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: No sign of them. ' Norman covers Taylor with a poncho, then starts going t his personal effects.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Where the hell's the map?

dialogues.speaker: " ATWATER
dialogues.text: He was holding it, I remember. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: The compass is broken.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: How'd that happen?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: I must of hit it on the side of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Shit! Youngblood? What the hell you tip us over for?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: And where's your weapon?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Lost it. Norman. looks around.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Atwater, where's yours?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: With Wilson's.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: In the water.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Well it's going to cost you. You're going to pay for losing them you know. $253.50.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Wilson. Where's the radio? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pause. 47.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: ...With my rifle.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: How much that gonna cost me?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be in charge of it! What the hell's the matter with you!

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Hey, man. Kiss my ass.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Let's go get those fuckers.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Sure. All we have to do is swim sixty yards and then find them back in that forest.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We'll follow through with our mission. That's our responsi- bility. Authorities will be back here to deal with these bastards.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Those guys were just firing a warning shot to scare us.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: They're doing a hell of a job.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Come on, let's haul ass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: You know something we don't.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: We need some distance. Instead of us going after them they might decide to come after us.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Shit. There's only two of them.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Lot more than that. And they're all related.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: What about Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: ' MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Leave him.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No. We'll take him with us. He deserves that much.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: I say we leave him. Unless you want to carry him...we can bury him here.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: He's an American soldier. He's got the Bronze Star, Purple Heart, and Vietnam Service medal.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: +.eSo what? The quicker we get out of here, the quicker they can come back for him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Make's sense...Come on Norman, let's get moving.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: God damn it we're not leaving him here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Who says.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: God damn it I got the stripe. I'm in charge and I don't want to hear any more about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The. men are soaked...sweating...Norman leading the way. the rear. Wilson and Youngblood carry the poncho stick stretcher. Masterson patrols the rear, alert for possible attack fro

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Think Norman knows where he's going?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Eight to five against.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Let's knock off that negative, crap. He knows about the army, give him that much.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLL
dialogues.text: What I want to know is does he know the way home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longbrake you are one dumb son of a bitch, firing that machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Me? What about you! You shot at them!

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Forget it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Forget it, shit!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: That's right, Longbrake. Who gave you the order to fire?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It's not funny, asshole! Masterson calls up from the rear.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Hey, he wasn't the one that shot Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: No, all you guys had a hand in that one. They trudge by.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAMPSITE DUSK
dialogues.text: Fog moving through the swamp in cloud-like patches. Buzzi insect sounds. The men of Bravo Team sit shivering in the ponchos by a small fire. Calvelli slaps at his face.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: God damn bugs.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: They're just gnats. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sl.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Man y'oughta look at them fuckers under a microscope. They got teeth for miles.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I got em in my ears, up my nose and down my throat.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Maybe if you wouldn't talk so much they wouldn't get in.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Hell, Merc's wear short pants in Rhodesia. Think of that. Atwater non-plussed at Norman's illogic.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: We'll keep that in mind. I'll = tell you something else to think about. We got a dead man here, and we got to find our way out.

dialogues.speaker: . LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: I'm telling you after we get Taylor back to headquarters we should come back after these Cajun cocksuckers.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You guys handle it. I've had enough shooting to last me a while... Calvelli looks at Masterson.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: You say these guys are Cajuns?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah...fuckin' savages. Lay (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I went to some kind of Cajun luau when I first got here... Atwater can't believe what he's hearing.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Cajun luau?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I don't know what it was called... | It was some kind of party with ' crayfish and gumbo, all that shit.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Jambalaya.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Whatever...They didn't look like any kind of savages to me. The toughest it got was accordion music.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Cajuns in St. Charles or Lafayette are okay. The ones still living back here are a whole other story.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: They're weird. Youngblood cuts loose in his most sonorous classroom tone

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: What he means is they've maintained the traditional Cajun culture. Really they're magnificent anachronisms.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Right. They even fuck their sisters. Even their grandmothers. This is too much for Longbrake. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: I ain't shittin' you. Swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Pause. What I want to know is will they fuck with us?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Goddamn right they will.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: They don't like outsiders comin' in here.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: If you knew all this, how come you stole the boats?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Hell I ain't afraid of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Maybe it's about time to divide up the bullets.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Masterson's got live ammo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: © WILSON In the truck, he was showin off a boxful of 5-56's. Norman looks at Masterson.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What's this a military secret or something? Norman gets up and stands before Masterson. The rest watc

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Let me see your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Just stay on back.

dialogues.speaker: . NORMAN
dialogues.text: Let me have the rounds, Masterson. Takes another step.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We'll divide them up, equally. Share them.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Bull shit. The others have moved in, close, but not too close.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: It ain't right, Lonnie.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Masterson, I'm giving you a direct order. Give them to me. Masterson points his M-16 at Norman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: You come one step closer Norman, and I will. Tense pause.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Hell Lonnie! We're soldiering together!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It's a court martial offense. Give me the ammo and we'll drop the whole thing, or else I'm turning your ass in.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit what you do. From Masterson's side Calvelli moves in close, a flash -- a switchblade appears at Mastersons' throat.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Quit fucking around. Give him the bullets. Masterson slowly undoes his pocket. Tosses the box of shells to Norman. Calvelli puts the rifle away. Starts to move off.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Where does it go from here?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Court martial?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We're all soldiering together. Atwater comes up to Calvelli. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: That's how they do these things in the Ivy League.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Villanova's not Ivy League...and I had this a long time before I went there.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You just brought it along for luck.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: First time I ever spent a weekend with eight gun toting red-necks.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: That's right. If we don't carry guns we're carrying ropes...R.C. colas and moon pies. Not too smart but we sure have fun. & Smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men trying to protect themselves from the bugs. Young speaks out to no one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: We should be in maximum con- cealment. What the enemy sees, is what he takes.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Knock that enemy shit off. Norman strides up from the other side of the clearing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman looks over at Wilson. 57.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna post guard; two men, four hour shifts.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Start with me. Don't feel like sleeping anyway.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Longbrake, you take the other side. Youngblood and Masterson goon relief at 2300...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman moves off. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Keep the perimeter secured tight. WILSON . Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: The password's "Werewolf". Got it?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Fassword? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: ...What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Nothing to do.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You play bridge by any chance?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Bridge? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: © ATWATER Yeah. It's a card game.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I play.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Really...Hey, Norman, we got the one thing this outfit needed. A fourth for bridge...Hey Coach! Atwater takes out a soggy deck from his pack. Shuffles.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH AND YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Both men at the perimeter of the clearing; Smith lights a joint...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: How can you smoke that crap? a SMITH (takes a big hit) I ain't on your team, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: God damn right you're not. You couldn't. make the Squad. That stuff kills the will to win.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: How'd your boys do this year? He knows the answer.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Three and seven. Injuries to key personnel. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: What do you do for a living, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I work in the welfare department. Atwater shouts across the clearing to Youngblood.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Come on, Youngblood. We got us a couple of pigeons. Youngblood still looking at Smith, question marks surroun his face.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Welfare department?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Yeah. One day a week. Hard work going down there and picking up my check. Those lines get awful long.

dialogues.speaker: . YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Very funny. Ho, ho, ho. Now Smith is really having a good time with Youngblood.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Course I pick up a little cash pimping here and there but most of what I turn over comes from selling dope to high school kids. A long look from Youngblood.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: You're a laugh riot, Smith. It's a good thing I don't believe you. He walks away and joins the waiting bridge game with Atwa Calvelli and Norman.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, CAMPSITE MORNING
dialogues.text: First light of day. The Squad has packed up for the day's march; first they have formed a loose circle.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Masterson, you hold point... Keep contact in file, don't start straggling. Anybody gets behind, start shouting, we'll all hold up. Atwater gives him the wagonmaster bit.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Forward ya.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Knock that off. Okay. Let's go. As long as we stay North we'll be okay. The Squad heads into the dense forest.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, NARROW TRALL
dialogues.text: Along the edge of the bayou. Masterson moving cautiously along, then stops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight dead rabbits hanging from a tree limb alongside the trail. Thin cord around each of their throats. Each anima has been gutted.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Norman at the head of the column as the Squad comes up be Masterson. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: What the hell's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: To no one Pause. Don't mean nothing. Some dude just drying his skins.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Funny way of stretching a skin.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You sure these weren't left for us? in particular.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Masterson?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: I ain't sure. But I know how I'd bet.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: There's eight of them.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: There's eight of us.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Let's keep going.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Right. We ain't gonna do any good right here no matter why they was left. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He moves off; the Squad slowly following.

dialogues.speaker: AT A FORK IN THE BAYOU MORNING
dialogues.text: The men are bitten up, eyes bleary red. Beards stubbley. Here the bayou is narrower as it splits. The air hot and muggy. The men try to determine which way they should go.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Fork to the right's East. Probably easier to get where we want moving that way. They move off down the right fork; Atwater yells up at Norman from ten paces back.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You want to be headin North. The Interstate's North.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We're going to the Interstate.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Not if you go East. The Interstate's North.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you Atwater. What the fuck you know?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I know there's a big fireball in the sky that usually rises in the East and we're walking right into it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: You have to go East to go North, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You want to run that by me one more time? You got to go where to do which?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It's my responsibility, Atwater. We're going East to get North.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Do what you want, zip. Atwater moves back to where Wilson and Youngblood are car the poncho stretcher. They all slosh off, following Norma

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Staff command. They should be wondering about us, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: No, Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: We've been out of contact for 12 hours.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Should be lookin' for us by now.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: No way. We were supposed to meet the trucks twenty minutes ago. In another hour and a half the trucks (More) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ATWATER (cont'd) will show up. By two o'clock they'll ask around if anyone's seen us. At three, they'11 start checking the bars. By four they'll really get pissed. By five it will occur to some- body that maybe we got lost. By six the Captain will consider calling Battalion. At seven thirty he will. Battalion will tell him it's too late, there's nothing they can do till morning... That make you guys feel any better? They move past. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE SUN
dialogues.text: blazing through the foliage overhead.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Norman plods by followed by Longbrake and Masterson carry the stretcher. Despite the fact it is only late morning, the day is already searingly hot.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: He's getting heavy.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be too much longer.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Why don't we leave him and come back?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No. I told you before. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: It's two hundred degrees...This son of a bitch is starting to blow up like a balloon. Taylor's body becoming distended beneath the poncho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be calling Taylor that.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: He can't hear me.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I can! And, I don't want you calling him that.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Shit, Norman. The cocksucker's~ dead. I'm just talking about the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it, Masterson! I don't want you calling him any of that shit!

dialogues.speaker: TWENTY YARDS BACK
dialogues.text: Wilson, Smith, Youngblood.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Man, somebody put out the sun. My head's on fire.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Take your damn helmet off.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Want me to get skin cancer too? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Quit bellyaching like a bunch of women. My high school kids scrimage with full pads in weather hotter than this.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Coach.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck. you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masterson running full speed through heavy undergrowth; dodging among trees and bushes, moving to the water's edg at a backwash feed along the bayou's perimeter. His foot falls squishing loudly against the humming sound of insects and strident bird calls. | Finally the rest of the Squad moves into view; Norman i first position, Atwater and Calvelli next, then Longbrake and Wilson. Youngblood and Smith trail along, Taylor's body stretchered between them. Norman looks up as Masterson runs to a full stop, then fi | to get his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it? More deep breaths.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Wha'd you find?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: We got one up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Something up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: We got one of them. curt TO:

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Military glasses with coordinate point lines. A Trapper i visible outside his shack on the bayou. He squats in the mud, mending his nets. His shack is four walls sitting up on sticks. A pirogue is pulled up on the bank.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN ,
dialogues.text: That's him. That's the sonuva- bitch.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Let me look.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Where's the other one?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Far as I can tell, he's alone.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Masterson sights the Trapper in with his M-16; Norman pus his barrel aside.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No. We're gonna capture him.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: What for? I can get him from here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: This is the U.S. Army, not the vigilantes. Atwater looks through the glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You sure that's him? Hands the binoculars to Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Oh, man. No question about it. Norman pulls out the box of 5-56's and starts dispensing the shells.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Why don't you try talking to him before you start blowing his head off.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Masterson. Wilson. Longbrake. Remember the initial action must be decisive. Surprise is the key. Five bullets each.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Hey, you hear what I said?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I heard you...We'll talk to him after we've captured him. Rest of you are the rear element. Stay 100 meters behind us and keep down. Marry up when the objective is sealed off. Let's move out. They fan out and start through the swamp. Atwater and Calvelli watch them go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: | ©) CALVELLI You always get out of everything?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I don't see you stickin your hand up to volunteer.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Four of them, with automatic rifles, against the one guy with a knife...I make it even ] money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start trailing the men.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH AND YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Carrying the stretcher, moving after Calvelli and Atwater cur TO: eS NORMAN - IN THE SWAMP He looks to his right, hand signals to Longbrake and Masterson to spread out and get down. Norman drops to his stomach and crawls, cradling the rifle. The side of the shack is visible...He fixes his bayonet.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON CRAWLING UP BEHIND THE SHACK
dialogues.text: The Trapper has his back turned and sits framed by the supports. The stilts supporting the shack are high enough for a man to walk under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crawling up on the other side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: To his far right; his M-16 ready.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAJUN TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Impossible to tell if this was one of the Cajun men encou tered earlier...Mending his net. Half his left arm missin He works the knife, sewing as he goes...Birds in flight m him look, and turn. He jumps up just as:

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTACK FORCE
dialogues.text: comes bursting out at him from all sides.

dialogues.speaker: . NORMAN
dialogues.text: Freeze! The Trapper stands, holding his knife, the Riflemen come toward him.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Quoi? Qui @t es vous?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Easy now. We want to interrogate him. From all sides they close in on the Trapper; he falls int the Cajun patois.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Quiest que vous voulez, hein?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: (pointing with rifle) Drop the knife.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Surrender.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Je nlai rien fait. Masterson moves even closer; eyes threatening, he gesture with his M-16.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch, drop the God damn knife. The Trapper realizes what he is being asked to do, he dro the hunting knife.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Qu'est que vous... WHACK! Wilson steps in and slams his rifle butt against t Trapper's mouth, instantly dropping him into the mud,

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You broke his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: WILS ON
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We want him to talk.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Knocked his mouth clear down to his ass.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: How can he talk with a busted jaw?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: That's his problem. Longbrake eyes the doorway to the shack. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Comeon, Lonnie. Let's see what's inside. Longbrake and Masterson move off toward the entrance to t Trapper's hovel.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, Wilson. What the hell did you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: The son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON AND LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: They climb the rope ladder, position themselves on the po right and left of the door, rifles ready. With a nod, Masterson kicks the door and they move inside, ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE NET
dialogues.text: Norman's searching the Cajun, Wilson stands over the fall man...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Where's the rest of your bunch? How many more are there?

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Ma bouche. Norman sees Atwater, Calvelli, Youngblood and Smith arriv through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Come on in, the area's secured. They come over. All gaze down at the Trapper. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We got us a prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Did you have to cut his arm off too? Masterson comes out on the shack porch, waving some pelts together. Longbrake's voice can be heard from inside the

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: All kinds a shit in here. He steps outside, next to Masterson.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Allright, no looting.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: What do you say to that, Longbrake?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Guard the prisoner, Wilson. Tie him up. And don't bust him again. Norman takes off for the shack. Atwater, Smith and Calvelli give Wilson a puzzled look.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn right.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Why'd you want to go and do that for?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I don't know, I just got pissed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Damn, man. This army bullshit is getting to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman walks in and finds Masterson and Longbrake tearing the place apart. It's a wooden plank hut, sealed with mud and thatched roof. Wooden shelves, with canned goods, bun burner, and kerosene lamp. Some animal traps. Rag quilt o the floor over a swamp moss mattress. Playboy centerfold wall next to picture of Christ and crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Get drunk, Norman. Longbrake hands Norman a jug...He takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Yecch!

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Look at this knife I found. Holds a huge hunting knife, suddenly a spotlight shines o both of them.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: God damn, this boy's a poacher. Masterson holds two dry cells taped together with a big b

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: We poached the poachers.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: He shined his last gator.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: He don't Look big enough to night wrestle gators. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: He ain't. That's what the light's for. Freezes ‘em. Longbrake is pocketing the canned goods.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Turnips, corn, white beans, rice, hog head cheese...

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Here's a box of shells, half-full... They start to leave.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Knives, guns, supplies...I'd say we conducted a pretty successful raid. n

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: As. Norman, Longbrake and Masterson approach with all the goodies. .
