dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Wilson, I told you to tie the prisoner up. :

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Now how am I supposed to tie the man up when he only has but one hand to tie?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Tell. you how to do it. You tie it around his. fuckin neck and lynch the sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: It's a great old Southern tradition but maybe we ought to try talking to him first. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Who speaks French...Youngblood?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Yeah. Wanders off toward the hut; pays no attention to them.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I'll give it a try. Moves to the Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You: speak English? The Trapper shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Hier. Quelq'un...shit. I can't remember how to say ‘shoot’...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: How about bang bang?

dialogues.speaker: ' CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Hier quelq'un.,.bang (indicates shooting) +.eun ami...

dialogues.speaker: CAJUN
dialogues.text: J'ai fait rien.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I think he's saying he didn't do anything. It doesn't sound like any French I ever heard. te MASTERSON What the fuck is this? I saw him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Christ, yes.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Iwas there too. I couldn't swear to anything...I can't even remember if the guy had one arm.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: While all this has been going on, he has walked over to t shack and begins climbing the rope ladder.

dialogues.speaker: INIT. SHACK
dialogues.text: Youngblood looks around... Moves off, kicks an old paint The red paint inside is still good. He looks at the ax an steel animal traps, finds a glass jar and picks up the ke sene lamp...starts pouring the kerosene into the jar.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Norman is reasserting his authority.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We'll take this man back with us for interrogation at Staff Command, then he'll stand trial. Atwater and Calvelli look at each other. Longbrake offers the jug of moonshine.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Anyone want some Cajun whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: About time one of you said somethin' makes sense. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Get us high as a Georgia pine. Smith drinks then passes it over.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: If you don't go blind.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, listen up. Everybody over to the rain barrel, fill your canteens. I want to put some miles between.us and here. We should make the Interstate by this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE SHACK
dialogues.text: Youngblood is enjoying a private joke, chuckling to himse The paint can now open and brush in hand. He removes his shirt and calmly paints a red cross on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD AT THE WATER BARREL
dialogues.text: Longbrake and Masterson are in a water fight, the rest ar finishing up as Youngblood comes down the ladder, Calvell is the first to see him and the Molotov cocktail Youngblo holds in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Oh fuck.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: (laughing) And the mark of Cain shall stain them forever. Youngblood is down the ladder, and the entire Squad can n see him as he lights the rag fuse. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Hit it! They run for cover...dive for the ground.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Slowly walks away from the shack, the fuse burning...Then turns'-and throws the jar at the shack. i

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Fire one!

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: as. the shack gets blown away. Brilliant orange flames ro upward as everything erupts in fire, sending splinters of burning wood flying into the bayou...Debris and flames fi the air.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: walks calmly to where the rest of the Squad has dived for cover. He stops, looks at them...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: That'll teach them to fuck with us.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. Can't argue with that.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What the hell did you paint the cross on your chest for, Youngblood?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Just part of the joke. He Laughs.  ©@

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAPPER
dialogues.text: silently looking at the ruin of his cabin.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: hitches up his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Let's get going, Norman. He starts off. cur TO:

dialogues.text: Norman leading the Squad slowly forward; Masterson not on point but simply holding ‘position alongside the teamlead

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: He sure demolitioned that shack. Blew it clear to kingdom come..

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Yeah. Only problem is that it might. have been a signal for this cocksucker's relatives to gather round.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Shit, yes. But I'll tell you who ought to worry about them a lot more than me and you.

dialogues.speaker: _. WILSON
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Longbrake 81.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON .
dialogues.text: They think you guys are bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: They might be right. I been hanging out with niggers my whole life. I haven't got a break yet. is running out of patience. » LONGBRAKE Any chance we're ever going to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: God damn right. I figure two hours tops before we hit the- Interstate.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Either two hours from the Interstate or New York by Friday.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP FOREST
dialogues.text: The Squad comes moving forward.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: God damn it, Norman, where's the highway? It's been three fucking hours.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It's right around here, close by.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, Norman.. It used to run right through here. |. Those ecology boys must have moved it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: , CG
dialogues.text: . Fuck you, Atwater. Atwater calls ahead to Longbrake, twenty yards to the fro

dialogues.speaker: . ATWATER

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Thanks, Longbrake.

dialogues.text: The iron jaws of six steel traps are just visible above t crude cover of twigs and moss. The Guardsmen move right for them, unaware. Norman is heading straight into one, unseeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! He grabs Norman.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Look what ya almost stepped in!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! They gaze at the open jaws. ‘ NORMAN Some. kind of fuckin bear trap.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Lookit this bastard. : Ss "(CONT INUED)

dialogues.text: Atwater, Calvelli, Wilson and Smith move up.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Eight of them, all laid out.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Just like the rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: They was set for us?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Shit, yes.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Either us or the last eight bears in the state of Louisiana. Masterson releases one by ‘shoving a stick into the The trap snaps shut, it's jaws clang out, biting.

dialogues.speaker: _ MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Just like a steel pussy.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Really? What kind of girls you been hanging out with?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Good thing you spotted them, Longbrake.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Don't mention it. Anytime you need help, Norman. opening. Calvelli. looks at the Cajun, points to the steel traps.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Q'est que c'est? No response. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: What did you ask him?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What they were doing here... Masterson grabs the Trapper and starts squeezing his brok jaw.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Okay you sonuvabitch. Still no response.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Are there any more? Huh? I'm . talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: He ain't gonna tell you shit. You know that Lonnie. Masterson releases the Trapper.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay. They didn't get us and they're not gonna, we wasted enough time. Let's saddle up; the Interstate ain't far. Longbrake again moves to point. Smith flanks the right si of the group; moving along the trail's edge...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Don't make any unnecessary noise. No talking in formation. He. takes six steps when, from out of nowhere, a wooden s rips deep into Smith's mid-section.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: his face frozen in death, eyes staring at the object stuc (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: in his chest. The stake is fastened to a branch and keeps him standing upright, until his dead weight finally break free.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Unable to move, they only stare in horror and silence.,. finally:

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Calvelli moves over the dead body to examine the weapon. The stake is finely hand honed and tied to a branch, alon with another pointed spear, several feet away. Calvelli slaps the second bent branch with his rifle, releasing another stake which snaps into place a few feet from his stake. aad CALVELLI These fuckers are after us. They really are. The rest of the Squad staring at Smith's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within a small clearing. The Squad stands in prayer befor two graves. Crude wet-wooden branch crosses. Masterson stands guard with the Prisoner and acts as sentry...Young blood is speaking in a low, deep tone.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: Qur Father who art in Heaven, hallowed be Thy name. Thy Kingdom come, Thy will be done, on Earth as it is in Heaven. Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our trespasses, as we. forgive those who trespass against us. Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For Thine is the Kingdom... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: For Thine is the Kingdom... For Thine is the Kingdom... Long pause, Youngblood continues staring straight ahead. Nervous looks from the rest of the Squad as they turn the attention from the two shallow graves to the hulking Youn blood -- He continues to stare abstractly at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: For Thine is the Kingdom, and the Power, and the Glory forever. Amen. . Youngblood raises his look to the graves.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: We give this prayer as dead men asking for our own salvation. Norman steps into the center of the clearing, standing be the entire Squad.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I don't want to hear that kind of talk...We're at war. That's all there is to it, sol want you looking like soldiers not mail men. Weapons carried at ready...we've got three hours of daylight left and we're headin' North...Let's move. He turns and moves across the clearing; the Squad look at one another momentarily and then begin to follow.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE CLEARING DUSK
dialogues.text: The Squad appears, slowly trudging forward. Norman holds them up in the center of the open space. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: This is it. We'll bivouac here. Clearing this big will make it tought for those bastards to sneak up on us. Youngblood sits down on a log then looks continuously at the ground before his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right. Now let's get a few things straight, Norman. Tomorrow morning helicopters will be out looking for us. Damn good chance they'll find us if we stay in clear ground. So what we have to worry about until then is the Cajuns...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We don't know the enemy's dispo- sition or his strength. He may have the advantage of familiar terrain, but we have the advan- tage of military training. Remember the 5 D's. Detect, deny, deceive, defend, and destroy.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Great speech, Norman. But I want to make our odds a little better.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What are you going for? Atwater points at the Trapper, still being covered by Masterson.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Maybe they want him back. Maybe that's all they want. Let's take the chance and let him go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Bullshit. He killed Taylor. The only place he's going is with us.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: They're fixin' to kill us all.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Gag and blindfold the Prisoner, Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Norman, you're a dumb asshole, Norman steps forward and slams Atwater in the face with h right fist.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: still sitting on the log, staring downward.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: ' speaks very calmly to the now flush-faced Atwater.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I don't want any more talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. You got the stripe, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: God damn right I do. He looks over at Longbrake. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: The jokes are over. Then at the Squad.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning we're heading North with the Prisoner. The man that killed Crawford Taylor, the man whose buddies. killed Tyrone Smith...In case you forgot Atwater, they were. friends of ours. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Now let's get unpacked and bedded down, I'll post security. No fire tonight. The Squad drop their packs, begin undoing them.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: looking at Atwater as he rubs the spot alongside his chin where Norman hit him. He moves closer; Atwater unsnaps the buttons on his back- pack...

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: You might be right about the Cajun. Atwater looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Why the hell didn't you say something?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I don't know...I just can't believe any of this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Let me know when you start.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: still sitting on the log.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CAMPSITE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Moonlight is now the only source of illumination.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAPPER
dialogues.text: tied to a tree near the edge of the clearing. A sock stuf into his mouth and held in place with friction tape. His eyes turn and follow Longbrake moving across in front him, approaching Norman who is busy working while seated a canvas groundcloth.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: stops to watch Norman put small rocks into an empty can o peas taken from the shack.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: I got something to tell you, Norman...hey what's that for?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Fragmentation...Remember your training. You shouldn't of been sleeping in the survival class.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I musta missed that one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ® NORMAN a: S, size up the situation. understand what you're up against. R, remember where you are. V, value living. 1, what's I?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Improvise. Even blank rounds can save your life. He pours the gunpowder of a shell into the can.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Atwater told me to come over and talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What's he want? ‘ ’ LONGBRAKE s It's Youngblood. There's something wrong with him. He won't talk. Atwater says he's gone crazy. You better come on over...I think Atwater's right.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: now standing near the comatose Youngblood; the rest of th Squad behind, looking over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Youngblood, look, we all have had a rough time and I can understand if you're not feeling too good...Why don't you just talk to us about it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SUNDAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Youngblood. No response.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I'm giving you an order, Youngblood. Now God damn it talk to us. No response. Norman turns to the rest of the Squad. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I do. The motherfucker's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: What are we going to do with him?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Leave him there. Maybe he'll feel better in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Bullshit! You're going to tie his-ass up, Norman. This is the guy that made his own bomb, remember? I don't want him walking around here tonight, while we're sleeping. The entire Squad now staring at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: He's right.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: He is, Norman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SUNDAY NIGHT
dialogues.text: Norman looks over at Masterson.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: Won't hurt any to tie him up.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: If he's tied up we lose potential firepower. 4 ATWATER. Jesus Christ, get a God damn rope and quit jerking off about firepower. .

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Remember what happened the last time you shot your mouth off to me, Atwater.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Come on, Norman. He's right. He's Pause. Turns and

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: way too big and dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, Wilson, there's forty feet of rope in my pack. Go get it. walks away.

dialogues.speaker: SLEEP ING NIGHT
dialogues.text: Heavy rain is falling.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: on sentry pulls his Pause. anes, 93. duty at the far side of the clearing. He stands, listening...Thinks he heard something...sits back down an Poncho over his head, (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then again he stands; listens and looks... He can see the rest of the Squad sleeping; The dark fores surrounding all...A twig cracks in the bush...after a mom Calvelli starts to move quietly; not waking any of the ot Calvelli now travels through the underbrush to the edge o the bayou where he sees:

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: holding the Trapper's head under water. The Cajun is on his stomach, a rope ties: his arms behind his back -- Mas son lets his head up momentarily then pushes it back into the muddy water. The Trapper goes under, spitting bubbles

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What the hell you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: This man's going to talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Let him up.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: You stay out of it. Keeps holding his head under. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: God damn it let him up!

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Sure. Masterson yanks the Trapper's héad out of the water, pull him up by the hair. The Trapper surfaces, lungs bursting for air.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERS ON
dialogues.text: Now you happy? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Masterson shoves the Trapper back in. In a flash, Calvelli's right hand slashes out - the switc blade cutting along Masterson's poncho...a warning slash.

dialogues.speaker: MASTERSON
dialogues.text: That's the second time you pulled that on me. Masterson takes out his bayonet. The long blade glistens the night rain. . Calvelli backs away. Masterson keeps coming. Slash...slash. Calvelli has no choice. The two men circle.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Okay, you got it. Masterson lunges for the gut. Calvelli takes the feint an leans back as Masterson continues the thrust upwards, bar raking Calvelli from jaw to cheek. A fine line of blood seeps out of the razored cut. Masterson smiles. They circle each other, feinting for an opening; Masterso bayonet cutting circles through the falling rain. Calvelli's left hand grabs Masterson's right wrist in mid air, pulling it sideways, pitching Masterson off balance. Calvelli pounces, the two men go down, each holding the other's knife wrist.

dialogues.speaker: ROLLING IN THE MUD
dialogues.text: Once, twice. On the third roll the flash of the Cajun Trapper coming to his feet breaks Calvelli's concentratio For a moment, their eyeballs lock. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Kill him. They roll over again. Calvelli on top, on bottom, on top again. Loses the switchblade. His leverage has Masterson's wrist bent backwards, forcin the bayonet from Masterson's grip. They roll over and com apart. Each man up quickly, each dives for the blade lost in the mud. Calvelli now has the bayonet. Masterson now has the switc blade. Masterson lunges. Catches Calvelli off guard. Calvelli throws his left arm up to block the stab. The switchblade plunges into the lower flesh of Calvelli's bicep and stic Calvelli's knife hand lashes up, misses, but his knuckles catch Masterson flush on the jaw, a solid right hook. Masterson stumbles backwards, leaving the switchblade stu in Calvelli's arm.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE WAY
dialogues.text: Norman, Atwater, Wilson come running up through the under brush. Stop and stare at the two struggling men.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: leaps on top of Masterson; they both go down hard... Masterson on his back; Calvelli on top of him. Calvelli's left wrist is pressed tight under Masterson's pinning him, gagging him. Calvelli's shaking right hand holds the bayonet shoulder high...Masterson is totally vu nerable, his empty arms stretched out in surrender...tota at Calvelli's mercy. Calvelli brings the bayonet up higher. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Kill him. Hesitates. Higher. Hesitates. Then plunges it deep into Masterson's heart. The sound of laughter. Calvelli keeps leaning on the bayonet...All his weight... Then slowly comes back up, staring at the dead man beneat him. He can't believe what he's done. Can't believe it. But it's there. Staring up at him. He did this. With his own hand. Calvelli gets to his feet. Sees the shocked faces of Atwater, Norman and Wilson; dis covering for the first time that they've been watching. Pause. Wilson walks over to Masterson's body; looks at his unblinking eyes.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: He's dead. Masterson's dead. Pause.,

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Your Prisoner got away, Norman. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What were you doing fighting each other? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman stands there, unable to comprehend.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus. We're not supposed to fight each other. Longbrake arrives, crashing through the vegetation -- he sees Masterson's body stretched before him.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Lonnie! He rushes over. Looks at Calvelli still holding the bayonet.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: You mother fucker! Springs at him but is caught and held back by Wilson and Norman. Longbrake wrestles against their grasp -- fightin to get at Calvelli who stands calmly looking at him, hand at his sides. e LONGBRAKE Let me get him, God damn it, let me get him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: keeps looking straight at Calvelli.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: bound by heavy ropes, standing erect, almost at attention His eyes remain clouded over, unseeing.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING NIGHT
dialogues.text: Twenty yards beyond Youngblood a few hours after Masterso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: death. The rain continues to pour down. Atwater and Wilson are digging a grave with their short infantry shovels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longbrake squatting down by Masterson's poncho covered bo Watching as the grave expands with each bite of the spade His steel helmet shining in the downpour.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE LOG
dialogues.text: Calvelli seated; calmly, emotionlessly watching the grave digging. Norman crosses behind him and approaches Atwater and Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: How many graves we gonna be leavin back here? Norman arrives in time to hear this last remark.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No more of ours, I can tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Yeah. You can tell me that. Calvelli stands, calls over to the gravesite.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: You talkin to me?

dialogues.speaker: . CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I'm talking to everybody. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman turns away from Calvelli, unable to face him; Wils and Atwater continue shoveling.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING DAWN
dialogues.text: The Squad huddled together in the pouring rain; forty yar beyond them is Masterson's freshly dug grave marked with wooden branch cross, steel helmet on the cross strut. The Guardsmen are all shivering inside their ponchos; their packs in place ready to march...Atwater holding the end of the rope that binds Youngblood.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: We have three casualties, we're not gonna have any more. Survival is a mental outlook. Shock and fear can be overcome by a sense of responsibility; Loyalty to country and military duty...Desire to return to home and family. If you are not prepared mentally to overcome all obstacles and hardships, the chances of coming out alive are greatly reduced.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Getting wet listening to all this, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: God damn you Atwater. I'm trying to do my best. It ain't easy.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I know you are, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You figure you can do any better? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pause. Longbrake 101.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I'm the team leader! You ain't even an E-5. You're...you're only an E-4!

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I'm with you. Sorry, Norman. NORMAN . The rest of you guys feel that way?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Longbrake?

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Norman, you promise that this asshole's gonna be court mar- tialed.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: He's got to be. He killed a fellow soldier. looks across at Atwater, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Changing horses in midstream never did make much sense.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Calvelli?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What's this voting bullshit? You know the way? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: @® ATWATER Yeah. I can find it, if it ever stops raining.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Then let's go.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Come on Youngblood, let's go home. Atwater tugs on Youngblood's rope, starts leading him awa

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute Atwater. You can't just march off. We're a Squad. A unit...

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Fuck him. Let him go.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It's desertion. s CALVELLI Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwater and Calvelli and Wilson start off. The other two watch. Atwater stops.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You coming? Norman moves toward Atwater. Then Longbrake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwater's tone to Norman is soft, gentle.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You're still in charge, Norman. I'm just the guide. They trudge away at an angle to the rising sun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SWAMP EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: More heavy rain. The men are soaked, shaking, filthy, hun tense. The surrounding vegetation is impenetrable, allowi little sunlight to filter through; moss hanging from ‘the like bearded columns.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER AND CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Leading the way. Behind Youngblood, quietly accepting his leashed condition, are Norman, then Longbrake -- Wilson trails.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Arm okay?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's okay. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Want to talk about Masterson? Look, I know he was a real son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLL
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: It was self-defense. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Pisses me off, those other guys gettin our whores while we're out here.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Do me a favor. Shut up. They move forward in silence.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Still trailing the rest of the Squad. Bird calls, branche and twigs snapping underfoot, then another sound. Twang. ‘ Twang. Twang. Twang. Wilson stops, pulls his M-16 to the ready position.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Hey. The others ahead stop...listen. Twang, twang, twang. A Jew's harp, not far off. Wilson suddenly wheels and fires into the swamp. The rest of the Squad drop. and move to cover, sighting along thei M-16's. All is still... Quiet... Twang. Twang. Twang.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Wilson?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I thought I saw something.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: You heard it.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Nothing now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Carefully, they get up and continue walking along the edg of the bayou. Twang. Twang. Twang.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers! He snaps. Starts to run off through the brush, firing his M-16. Twang. Blast. Twang. Blast. Wilson continues running, chasing the sound...Stops, his face twisting into an agonized mask...He tries to scream, mouth open, nothing coming out. When the cry finally bursts out it is a deafening cry of shock and terror. Along the edge of the bayou in front of him a scarecrow looms...

dialogues.speaker: THE SCARECROW
dialogues.text: Smith's black skin stretched out on the two crossed poles Taylor's white head sits at the top of the pole where Smi neck ends.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: As the rest of the Squad come pounding up behind him...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Holy. Christ.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: They dug ‘em up.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus. Jesus. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: His eyes take in the Scarecrow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: I pray the Lord my soul I pray the Lord my soul I pray the Lord my soul Twang, twang, twang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot, muggy. The Squad moving in file; Atwater holding to the edge of the bayou. Atwater.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Atwater, you still want write me up a policy?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Don't have my forms with me.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: That ain't funny.

dialogues.speaker: MONDAY MORNING
dialogues.text: to take. to take. to take...

dialogues.speaker: HIGH NOON
dialogues.text: leading the way -- still Wilson pulls alongside to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever wants insurance till they need it...Look Cleotis, right now there's state troopers, heli- copters, hound dogs, everybody in Louisiana's out looking for us...

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: They better make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I want you to remember this tomorrow when I make you sign. A few more paces; Norman calls out from twenty yards back (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Atwater. Hold up. We'll take two minutes rest. The Squad pulls up...Seat themselves, remove their helmet Youngblood remains standing, almost like a huge fleshy ro at rest.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Lights a cigarette...his last. He crushes up the package, tosses it away...Looks across at Atwater who is cleaning glasses on his shirtfront. Calvelli rises, moves to Atwat looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Get up. I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Away from the rest of them. Atwater stands, he and Calvelli move away from the others Atwater turns back to Calvelli, curious about the moment.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Okay. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I want to know what the fuck's going on.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I don't get you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. Pause. o 108.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I'll make it real simple...I'm down here two weeks and get sent out with a bunch of rednecks and two spades, all of a sudden guys start coming out of the trees and killing us...Now I'll ask you again. What the fuck's going on? What do they want?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I want to know what the rules are.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I figure you know better than me. You're the one that brought the knife. And you're the one that used it...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I'll tell you something. I'ma city boy, born and raised in Baton Rouge, and went to Vanderbilt, sell insurance for my father's company and don't work too hard...You want to know what's going on back here? I haven't got the slightest fucking idea. God damn Cajuns are weird and they're killing us... Calvelli shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Right back where I grew up.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. I'm depending on you.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: When you go into somebody's territory...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: They want to kill you. Turns and walks back toward the others.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF THE BAYOU
dialogues.text: The Squad moves along in silence, all of them save Youngb are apprehensive. As they pass, backs turned... Something moves along the bank of the bayou...The mud ris in a heap, dripping...from the slime a form emerges...

dialogues.speaker: A CAJUN MUDMAN
dialogues.text: All mire and hair, a troglodyte in appearance...He aims h rifle at the Squad's back, smiles and fires.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: As the swamp explodes with gun fire.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Ambush! Snipers! They dive for cover. Gunfire comes at them from all over. Front, rear, side. The Squad shoots back blindly, sprayin everything...Youngblood alone stands. Atwater rolls back for the abandoned rope end...grabs, tugs it and brings Youngblood down.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Youngblood! For Christ's sake!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN AND WILSON
dialogues.text: From behind the stump of a dead cottonwood.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: They got us flanked. We're pinned down.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Motherfucker! Norman fires twice then is out of ammo...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Cover me!

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: With what? All I got is blanks. Norman's contact with reality is now problematical.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No radio contact or ammo or air support, mortars. We got nothing. How we supposed to fight on that?

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Don't ask me. You're the one supposed to know. .

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Fire the God damn blanks... Wilson opens up, Norman breaks for it.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: He crawls thirty yards, dodges, runs...his M-16 left behi with Wilson. A burst of rifle fire and he darts in that direction...dives for cover behind a huge cypress and sit panting for a moment. Mudman appears thirty yards before him, firing...but has no idea of Norman's new position -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman reaches into his pocket and pills out the can he l with gunpowder and pebbles. The can is bound tight with v and a rag fuse is stuffed in the top. Shaking, Norman fum for a match, and lights the rag. It ignites. He holds the grenade, peeks out from behind the tree, stands and throw the grenade at the Mudman...A perfect toss.

dialogues.speaker: MUDMAN
dialogues.text: As the grenade hits and extinguishes itself. Nothing. No explosion. Mudman turns, sees Norman, and fires.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Running like hell, bullets kicking all around him...

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Norman tears. past them...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Pull back! Retreat! They move away to the continuing shots of the Cajuns. Sweating, panting, the men trip and stumble over vines an roots, sloshing in mud. Branches slash at their faces...

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: I can't go no more.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Come on, Longbrake. They pound forward, regroup, hurry on.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: They after us?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Keep going. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More running forward, trees, limbs, underbrush, mud...But no more rifle fire. Norman pulls them up. Atwater is pant fighting for oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hear it now. Norman frantically starts digging through his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Helicopter!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: My mirror. Where's my mirror! Through the mist, skirting along the treetops, the heli- copter, coming right at them. The men start waving, jumping, shouting. Norman is flashing his mirror...The Chopper passes right over their heads...and is gone. The men of the lst Squad stand in disbelief. Longbrake st walking off, after the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Qver here, over here. - Norman slowly starts to put away his mirror, then decid first clean its surface on his poncho.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I don't see how he missed us.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I could see his face.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Why didn't he see my signal? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Not enough sun.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Hey? Where's Longbrake?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: He was here a minute ago.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: Now running through the swamp after the vanished helicopt He tries to move faster...faster...faster...oblivious to brush and moss.

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: Shallow water and mud. Longbrake comes bursting through t So surrounding vegetation and begins splashing through th opening in the forest -- his face turned upward, still va looking for the chopper. Then he slows down. Slower. Slower. Full stop. | Begins to sink. Quicksand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUAD
dialogues.text: Norman yelling...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Longbrake! Longbrake! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Looks back at the others.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Spread out. We have to find him... Buddy teams, you and me, Wilson. First team to find him fire a blank every five minutes. Other team will work its way there.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What if we don't find him?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Wait an hour, fire five blanks and then one every five minutes. Both teams will work back to each others. Norman and Wilson start out; Atwater looks at Calvelli, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Come on, Youngblood. Jerks the rope.

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: He sees something...reaches out..pleading to be saved...

dialogues.speaker: A CAJUN BOY
dialogues.text: ten or eleven years old, sits at the edge of the bog; Fascinated, he watches Longbrake sink...Laughs at him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER AND CALVELLI
dialogues.text: leading Youngblood through the swamp. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Longbrake! Longbrake! You dumb red-neck where are you! Longbrake! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: WILSON AND NORMAN
dialogues.text: They move, cautiously looking...then leap backward, start as a Cajun with a huge black beard appears before them, Mudman behind them...off to one side a third Cajun with a Hawk-like face. Blackbeard steps forward, holding a razor edged Bowie knife... cur To:

dialogues.speaker: LONGBRAKE
dialogues.text: up to his neck...the Cajun boy watches Longbrake slowly disappear. Mouth, nose, eyes, forehead. A few gurgling bubbles and the swamp is once again still...The Boy moves off into the dense foliage and vanishes. Atwater's voice can be heard faintly in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Longbrake!

dialogues.speaker: WILSON AND NORMAN
dialogues.text: Norman leaps toward Hawk-face, swings his rifle by the ba and pole-axes the big man. Killing him instantly. Another Cajun appears at his side, Norman bayonets his mid-sectio

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Take off! Wilson starts running across the clearing. Norman reaches for Hawk-face's rifle...and is brought down by Mudman's (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: bullet, straight through the back and heart.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: running through the swamp. Never looking back, he dodges darts, cutting and weaving through the towering ferns... Eyes and lungs on fire, he staggers through the thicket a mud...doubles over, holding his side, breathing like a lo motive. He splashes his face from a pool of swamp water, rinsing and spitting, then forces himself on...Running ag then trips, recovers, scrambling now on all fours, knees touching the earth...He pitches forward _and drops exhaus shaking, afraid to move.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBEARD AND MUDMAN
dialogues.text: Coming at Wilson, he slides back, away, as they move sile closer. Wilson is on his feet now, back to a tree, corner He screams and lunges at the Cajuns, swinging his M-16 li a ball bat. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late afternoon sun; Atwater, Calvelli and Youngblood. Atwater fires five blanks. They wait. And wait. And wait.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: The only thing we're doing is telling the Cajuns where we are.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: They haven't had too much trouble finding us up to now.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGBLOOD
dialogues.text: It's just part of the joke. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Which makes no sense, but he is quite mad.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: Pause, he shouts again.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Let's go. They move up a steep embankment, cross through a ridge of ferns and begin a descent toward a new series of bayous a interlocking waterways. The maze of brackish water and dense foliage stretches before them like a vast crossword puzzle...beyond lies a forest of dead trees, leafless branches pointing upward, almost in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: No fucking way out. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are the helicopters? Where the fuck are we?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I thought you were the one that knew.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I know where we're going. I just don't know where we are.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Yeah...We better find something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the edge of the murky water. The three men trudge forward. Youngblood trailing, still being led by Atwater holding the short throw of rope.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Wait. Calvelli stops; Atwater points to a large nest-like congl eration of mud and branches.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: There's food.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What? Atwater goes to the dark mound, kicks it, waits, then war kicks it again. Suddenly an explosion of mud and water as a small alligator thunders out of its nest and into the r beyond...Atwater watches it go then reaches inside the ne and hands Calvelli a large, leathery egg. He reaches back inside and pulls out two more, gives one to Youngblood. Atwater stands holding one in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Protein. Atwater smiles. Starts to bite, then waits for Calvelli, who tops his and sucks it down. Atwater looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Come on, before it hatches.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You liked yours so much, you can have mine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Eat it. You're going to need all the strength you can get...I don't want you falling down on me. Atwater downs his.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Chow time, Coach. Going to untie you. Atwater begins to loosen Youngblood's ropes. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: WALKING DOWN A SMALL BAYOU LATE
dialogues.text: The three men now close to the limits of endurance. They move slowly along the deep banks, water covered with gree pads. Youngblood remains untied.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MUD BANK EVENING
dialogues.text: Atwater and Calvelli dig at the steep walls with their bayonets, making natural depressions wider. They claw at the dirt, passing it out in the steel pots. Youngblood stands watching the men carve out shelter for the evening

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The three of them lie on their sides. A small fire is boiling water in one of the steel helmets.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Tomorrow this time you'll be sitting in your den with a beer and the tee vee, listening to your old lady's bullshit. Pause. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Calvelli starts cleaning his wound.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Full of dirt. ~

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Infected?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Let me help you with that. Atwater wraps up Calvelli's arm.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Some nurse.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm easy. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Terrific state you got here, Atwater. They send out two helicopters. :

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What do you want them to do send out the National Guard?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BAYOU DAWN
dialogues.text: Sun starts to filter through the covering fog. Atwater sleeping heavily, exhausted...Calvelli in a sentry positi fatigue has taken its toll with him as well -- he sleeps (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: fitfully...Youngblood nowhere to be seen. The ground begins to shake, a roaring noise...Calvelli aw as the sound and shaking increase...Then suddenly from fi yards away a train whistle blasts...from out of nowhere a locomotive and flatcars roar by at seventy miles an hour. The railroad embankment obscured from Calvelli's vision b the dense foliage. Atwater leaps to Calvelli's side. They both run toward th embankment, shouting to each other above the roar.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Where the fuck did this come from?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I don't know but I love it. Big smiles on both men's faces; they slap five. After a few moments, the end of the train whips by...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER AND CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Maintaining their smiles...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Never been so glad... The eyes of both men tighten.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE TRACK
dialogues.text: Youngblood's body hanging from the limb of a cypress tree the rope that Atwater bound him with now forms a hangman' noose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwater and Calvelli slowly approach the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Poor son of a bitch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Did he do it himself or did they help him? Calvelli shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Doesn't make any difference now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two figures against the horizon line trudging slowly forw Thick foliage to their left, a long low reach of bayou to the right.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: Across the stretch of water a small movement...

dialogues.speaker: , CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Over there. Atwater looks.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What is it? Both men staring.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: A truck. Fucking truck. He starts running...Atwater lopes after him, tossing his rifle aside...the truck almost looks as if it's floating the water...they move closer...the horizon line changing with their progress -- crushed-shell road revealed on the far side of the bayou. As the truck moves toward the railroad crossing Calvelli starts running faster, screaming... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: | Has made a full stop at the crossing. The vehicle is a bed, old, delapidated, rusty...An Elderly Cajun Couple in front seat. Calvelli runs up, Atwater a few paces behind.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Wait...uh hello... The Elderly Man smiles nervously back at the two dishevel soldiers. The Woman doesn't smile at all. A very long pause. Atwater and Calvelli so moved by their first contact with civilization that words are difficult...Atwater notices t reluctance of the couple. ress . ATWATER They're scared.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Your guns. The way we look. Calvelli sets his M-16 down.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: No bullets anyway. Smiles at the Elderly Cajun Man and Woman.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You want lift?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yes. Oh God yes, do we ever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Both Cajuns laugh.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You get in back.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Sure.. Next town. Right?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Sure. Sure. The Elderly Man's grasp on English is limited; a problem little matter to Atwater and Calvelli, they hop on the fl bed of the pick-up...The battered vehicle pulls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flat-bed pick-up chugging along, Atwater and Calvelli stretched out in back. The truck turns down a narrow lane

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER AND. CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Watching the marsh country slip by on either side of them

dialogues.speaker: CAJUN
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: You're asking me? The flat-bed moves into a clearing...Many cars and trucks parked nearby; Campers, hay wagons...

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: EXT, CLEARING NEXT TO A HUGE BAYOU
dialogues.text: Two hundred or so Cajuns; men, women, children, and assor animals, have gathered next to a huge bayou for what is (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: known to the locals as a Shivaree. Music, dancing, gumbo, crayfish, jambalaya, alcohol make for a generally festive atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: FLAT BED TRUCK
dialogues.text: The truck bearing Atwater and Calvelli rolls into the cle

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER AND CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Hearing the music look over the truck to see what's going The sight of two hundred Cajuns even at play is not reass

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What the hell: is this?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I think it's one of those Cajun luau's you were talking about.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What happened to the town they were taking us to? Atwater shrugs. The truck has now stopped in what is curr passing for the parking area. Atwater and Calvelli jump d off the truck to confront the couple getting out of the t

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Where's the town? We want to go to town.

dialogues.speaker: MAN . .
dialogues.text: Eat first. Go ‘town later.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: No. We want to go to town now.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: First, eat. Have good time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Shivaree. You have good time. Town after. The couple is open, friendly and not to be dissuaded. Atw and Calvelli exchange a look and allow themselves to be l to the clearing. The woman continues chattering to them a they move off.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You eat. You drink. You have good time...

dialogues.speaker: BAYOU'S EDGE
dialogues.text: Atwater and Calvelli cleaning themselves up in the bayou. Children playing in the water around them. A short distan away, the band plays enthusiastically for a.crowd of danc clogging on wooded planking laid out on the soft ground.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLL
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I think I feel better. Cleaner anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: What about safer?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah...0On the other hand I don't think I'd lie down and go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Maybe we should forget about Mom and Dad and try for town by ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What for? If they're still hunting us, they'll find us in the swamps. We'll be safer here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLL
dialogues.text: Okay, but we grab a ride with the first car that leaves. They are startled by a popping sound behind them. They wheel around...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG CAJUN GIRL
dialogues.text: A sweet faced, smiling girl of about twelve has opened a of cans of beer which she now offers to our boys. Their s reaction makes her a little nervous. They smile.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Merci. She smiles and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Relax, boy. These are the good Cajuns.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: (unconvinced) Yeah. You relax. Atwater takes a long swallow of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is now in full swing. Calvelli is at the food table being served a huge plate of crawfish and gumbo. General gaiety abounds everywhere except Calvelli's face. As he takes his plate and moves through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: CAJUN FACES
dialogues.text: Strange smiles, missing teeth...All appear sinister to Ca

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: He sits down under a tree. He starts to eat, but continua looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the dancers, the band, everybody. He seems to ca people staring at him and then looking away as their eyes A pirogue poles up the bayou and beaches. Two men get out this distance they could be the two Cajuns who killed Tay

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: He stares at them. Atwater suddenly appears and sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you, boy?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Look at those two guys?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What two guys?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Getting out of the boat. He looks.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Yeah. .?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: They don't look like the guys we took the boats from? The ones who killed Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I don't know. They were too far away then. And they're too far away now. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I think it's them.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Man, don't go gettin' paranoid on me.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLT,
dialogues.text: I got reason to be paranoid. So do you. He gets up and starts for the food table. Calvelli contin to watch the two men. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men move into the clearing. It's impossible to say whether or not they are Taylor's killers.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Watching them.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAND
dialogues.text: Playing louder...faster. Ocarina guitar, violin, accordio Jew's harp.

dialogues.speaker: CYPRESS TREE HOG CAGES
dialogues.text: Two huge four hundred pound porkers in wooden cages. Two Cajuns approach the cages. One draws a huge gutting knife and runs it across the bars. The hog squeals. The men laugh. Then each man uncoils a rope and ties a noose. The are joined by the two men from the pirogue.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: He watches the conversation. He gets up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CYPRESS TREE
dialogues.text: The four Cajuns talking and laughing. It now becomes clea they are tying the ropes into hangman's nooses.

dialogues.speaker: FOOD TABLE
dialogues.text: Atwater is receiving a giant plate of food. He turns to s Calvelli moving quickly towards him, bumping into people, knocking over plates on his way. Finally as Calvelli reac him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Jesus, will you take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I'm getting out of here right now.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I don't think I want to stay for the hanging. He gestures in the direction of the cypress tree. Atwater

dialogues.speaker: CYPRESS TREE
dialogues.text: Two of the men are throwing the nooses over the branch of tree, and testing them for strength.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER AND CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Atwater laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Those are for bleeding the hogs.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: You're fucking crazy. (CONT INUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: I'm telling you...

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I'm not staying to see if you're right. Before Atwater can say anything, Calvelli suddenly takes Atwater follows.

dialogues.speaker: DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Calvelli trying to move through the crowd on the floor. Suddenly he's boxed in. A group of people with their arms locked together dance around him. They try to pull him in the dance. Calvelli panics. He punches one man, pushes another aside and races for the forest. The music stops. General confusion.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Moving across the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: No. Wait! You don't understand! Atwater runs off after Calvelli.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLL
dialogues.text: Running in dead panic...branches and foliage cutting at h face and arms, mud underfoot...he slows...begins walking, the carving knife in his right hand. A small glade appears before him, He enters, sees:

dialogues.speaker: THE CAJUN BOY
dialogues.text: He smiles, gestures to Calvelli...A very innocent looking (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: child; the same innocent looking child that watched Longb sink into the quicksand. Calvelli approaches cautiously, still holding his knife.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: I want to go home. The boy gestures Calvelli closer...closer. Then Blackbeard steps out from behind a tree. Aims his ri at Calvelli.

dialogues.speaker: CALVELLI
dialogues.text: Can't believe it anyway...He smiles as Blackbeard fires, for him. Blackbeard fires again...Calvelli gets to him, p the knife hard into his stomach... Now Blackbeard can't believe it. Knife sticking out...onl the handle visible. He shoots Calvelli again. Again. Cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Running through the swamp; he can hear gunfire...he appro a dense thicket, moves through, comes out into the glade.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, FOREST
dialogues.text: Atwater crosses to the two bodies. Calvelli sitting up ag a tree, eyes open and very dead. Blackbeard on his back, frozen into a final mask. The Cajun boy nowhere to be seen. Atwater moves near Calvelli, looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: We had it made. We had it made. Sound of a Jew's harp. Atwater turns...

dialogues.speaker: MUDMAN
dialogues.text: Standing there with his rifle...levels it...fires as Atwa dives for the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: The bullet slams into the log near his head, he rolls, an shot tears into the wood... He can see Blackbeard's rifle, and the knife sticking out his middle...Both out of reach...He rolls again as anothe shot tears home...Jumps up, makes a break for the trees.. another shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwater running through the swamp...running, running, run

dialogues.speaker: MUDMAN
dialogues.text: Following the trail of army combat boots. He moves silent relentlessly...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Still running but very fatigued...SLOWING...SLOWING...SLO Lungs bursting, he bends, doubles over, gasping...Can't m another step. He kneels down, starts to untie the lace on his combat boot... cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: MUDMAN
dialogues.text: He moves through the terrain, following the visible trail footsteps leading past

dialogues.speaker: A THOUSAND YEAR OLD DEAD CYPRESS
dialogues.text: Huge, bleached white, petrified. Just as Mudman walks by.

dialogues.speaker: FROM THE MASSIVE HOLLOW TRUNK
dialogues.text: His timing is perfect. The bootlace garrote has Mudman ar the neck.

dialogues.speaker: THE STRANGULATION
dialogues.text: Mudman pitches and spins, a wild Brahma bull, snorting an bucking, but his rider hangs on...Mudman runs backward, crushing Atwater against the great tree. Again. Again. But the garrote doesn't lessen...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER HANGING ON
dialogues.text: Mudman's elbows are pistons driving into Atwater's sides. Mudman reaches back, grabs a handful of Atwater's hair, t to pull Atwater's skull off, but the garrote doesn't less

dialogues.speaker: MUDMAN CRUMPLING
dialogues.text: As the breath is choked out of him; his legs can no longe support his weight...He stands quivering...makes one fina desperate reach back...

dialogues.speaker: MUDMAN ON HIS KNEES
dialogues.text: Then to his stomach...he flops face first into the mud... Atwater still sitting on his back, squeezing...Finally Atwater's hands let go of the two pieces of wood to which the bootlace is tied...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Staggers to his feet. He takes Mudman's rifle and knife..

dialogues.speaker: THE CAJUN BOY
dialogues.text: comes out of the swamp, in front of Atwater. Atwater backs away, he doesn't want any more...The Boy kneels next to Mudman...quietly sits there.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: looking at the Boy and the dead Mudman...he turns and run still carrying Mudman's rifle.

dialogues.speaker: A BAYOU
dialogues.text: dark water and moss covered lily pads. Atwater wades thro coming out in open marsh...up ahead he can see:

dialogues.speaker: A HILLY SLOPE OF GRASS
dialogues.text: He runs for it, sprinting, just as a Helicopter comes zoo across the tree tops...Atwater climbs the slope on the ru

dialogues.speaker: ON TOP OF THE LEVEE
dialogues.text: Running along its stone bed road, Atwater waves and chase the Chopper. Though it's gone from sight he still runs... FAINT MUSIC IS HEARD...voices singing, in Cajun French. Atwater looks around, listens, starts walking away from t levee, toward the direction of the singing...the music ge louder with each step. He stands poised, rifle ready...

dialogues.speaker: A WOODEN BUILDING AHEAD
dialogues.text: Pick-up trucks and campers parked in front. Some of the vehicles attached to trailers and outboard motor-boats...

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: Walking toward the bar. The music is very loud. Unmistaki Cajun French.

dialogues.speaker: QUTSIDE THE BAR
dialogues.text: He stops and gathers himself, wiping away the dirt and sw and blood...Lifts the rifle, bursts through the door read to fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwater's momentum carries him into the center of the roo A sign on the wall, "World's Greatest Jambalaya, World's Friendliest People". In one corner a group of Cajuns sing along to the Juke Box. The rest of the bar filled with...

dialogues.speaker: NATIONAL GUARDSMEN
dialogues.text: in their clean fatigues. They play pool, cards, pinball, darts...Some dance with Cajun Women. One of the Guardsmen looks up as Atwater enters.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Atwater. Hey! It's Atwater! The rest of the Guardsmen look up from their tables.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER. GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, Atwater, what the hell kind of show you been putting on?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: We been lookin' all over for you guys.

dialogues.speaker: ATWATER
dialogues.text: looks over at him. The Guardsman is at a table with Atwat four smiling Cajun girls...Their smiles more than a touch confused by his disheveled appearance.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GUARDSMAN
dialogues.text: Come on, Atwater. Have a beer. Atwater just keeps standing there and looking at them.
